summary: This is an email chain from May 29, 2008, discussing a pending meeting between the Deputy Attorney General's office and Jeffrey Epstein's representatives. It also contains a significant allegation from a new witness who states Epstein knew she was underage and told her he didn't care about age.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal investigation; his attorneys are arranging a meeting with the Deputy Attorney General's office. A new witness alleges he had sex with a minor and knew her age.

persons.name: M S
persons.context: The email author who received information about a meeting with the DAG and relays a new witness allegation about Epstein's knowledge of a victim's age.

persons.name: DAG
persons.context: The Deputy Attorney General whose office is involved in deciding on the Epstein case and is scheduled to meet with Epstein's representatives.

connections.description: M S is an investigator or prosecutor handling the case against Epstein and is relaying new evidence about him.
Epstein's representatives are seeking a meeting with the Deputy Attorney General's office regarding his case.

events.title: Email about DAG meeting and new witness
events.description: An email is sent discussing a pending meeting between the DAG's office and Epstein's people, and relaying a new witness allegation that Epstein knew a victim was underage.

events.title: Epstein's alleged statement about age
events.description: A girl, 14 or 15 at the time, reports that Epstein told her he had sex with a minor (M) and that he told her he doesn't care about age after she told him her true age.

keyFacts: A meeting was being arranged between the Deputy Attorney General's office and Jeffrey Epstein's legal team as of late May 2008.
A new witness (a girl) was interviewed who alleged Epstein told her he had sex with a minor (referred to as 'M'), who was likely 15 or 16 at the time of that conversation.
The same witness reported that she told Epstein her true age (14 or 15) and Epstein told her 'he doesn't care about age.'
The email author notes that Epstein's team will likely continue to claim Epstein didn't know the girls' ages, making this new allegation significant.
The email asks if the case was discussed with the Attorney General during a recent visit.
